body:
I have built OpenMPI 3.0.1 with GCC 4.8.5 on our system. In order to be batch system aware, OpenMPI is linked against some batch system libraries:

```
[spackapps@eu-develop-01 lib]$ ldd libopen-rte.so
        linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007fff59def000)
        libbat.so => /cluster/apps/lsf/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib/libbat.so (0x00002b03ee883000)
        liblsf.so => /cluster/apps/lsf/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib/liblsf.so (0x00002b03eec24000)
(skipping the rest of the ldd output)
```

When I now build an application like paraview 5.4.1 with the command

`spack install paraview@5.4.1+qt+hdf5+mpi~opengl2 ^qt@4.8.6+dbus+examples+gtk+krellpatch~webkit ^pango@1.40.3+X ^cairo@1.14.10+X ^harfbuzz@1.4.5 ^gdk-pixbuf@2.31.3 ^atk@2.21.90 ^gobject-introspection@1.49.1 ^hdf5@1.10.1+cxx+fortran+hl+mpi+szip ^openmpi@3.0.1+java+sqlite3 ^glib@2.56.0 ^pcre@8.41+jit %gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64`

then it fails with some undefined reference error, due to not finding the batch system libraries that OpenMPI is linked to:

```
     22693    /bin/ld: warning: libbat.so, needed by /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/openmpi-3.0.1-7rtx
              5m2zfevlmin7frsnmlspvvtvcjyj/lib/libmpi_cxx.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
     22694    /bin/ld: warning: liblsf.so, needed by /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/openmpi-3.0.1-7rtx
              5m2zfevlmin7frsnmlspvvtvcjyj/lib/libmpi_cxx.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
  >> 22695    /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/openmpi-3.0.1-7rtx5m2zfevlmin7frsnmlspvvtvcjyj/lib/libope
              n-rte.so.40: undefined reference to `lsb_sysmsg'                                                             
  >> 22696    /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/openmpi-3.0.1-7rtx5m2zfevlmin7frsnmlspvvtvcjyj/lib/libope
              n-rte.so.40: undefined reference to `lsb_launch'                                                             
  >> 22697    /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/openmpi-3.0.1-7rtx5m2zfevlmin7frsnmlspvvtvcjyj/lib/libope
              n-rte.so.40: undefined reference to `lsb_init'                                                               
  >> 22698    /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/openmpi-3.0.1-7rtx5m2zfevlmin7frsnmlspvvtvcjyj/lib/libope
              n-rte.so.40: undefined reference to `lsb_errno'                                                              
  >> 22699    /cluster/spack/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/openmpi-3.0.1-7rtx5m2zfevlmin7frsnmlspvvtvcjyj/lib/libope
              n-rte.so.40: undefined reference to `lsb_getalloc'                                                           
  >> 22700    collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
  >> 22701    make[2]: *** [Utilities/LegacyColorMapXMLToJSON/CMakeFiles/vtkLegacyColorMapXMLToJSON.dir/build.make:193: bi
              n/vtkLegacyColorMapXMLToJSON] Error 1  
```

My question would now be, how can I provide spack the paths to this library, such that it finds them, when needed for compiling an application linked to OpenMPI ? Is there a way in spack how I can add other paths to rpath, when I build OpenMPI ? Or would this paths needed to be added when building applications depending on OpenMPI ?

Any help is appreciated.
title: Making SPACK aware of batch system libraries required to make OpenMPI scheduler aware
